newsitem.title: JAPAN: S'tomo Metal Mining to boost capex,copper capacity.
newsitem.headline: S'tomo Metal Mining to boost capex,copper capacity.

text.p: Sumitomo Metal Mining Co said on Tuesday it would boost its 1997/98 capital spending by 73.6 percent from the year before to 15.8 billion yen and raise its annual refined copper capacity by 20,000 tonnes.

The largest spending increase will be in the metals division, in which capital investment will surge 153.1 percent to 8.1 billion yen in the fiscal year ending March 31, 1998, the company said in a statement.

Sumitomo will spend 2.1 billion yen to raise the Besshi smelter's annual copper production capacity to 230,000 tonnes this fiscal year from 210,000 tonnes, Yoshiaki Nakazato, manager of the corporate planning division, told Reuters.
Besshi's annual capacity will be raised further to 250,000 tonnes by the end of this century, he said.

Nakazato said Sumitomo Mining would spend another 2.1 billion yen in 1997/98 to consolidate its nickel and cobalt production facilities at one location in Besshi. At present the facility's smelters are scattered among different sites within Besshi.
